718440f-c.title: Manhattan: Central Park West - 62nd Street
718440f-c.text:
Central Park West, west side, north from 62nd Street, showing in foreground beginning of demolition work on Century Theatre.
December 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
(2)
The same, showing exposed boxes and stage of Century Theatre.
January 8, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
(3)
The same, taken from Seventh Avenue at ScE. corner of 59th Street, showing half-completed Century Apartments being erected
on former site of Century Theatre.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
718440f-c.folder: Central Park West & 62nd Street, Manhattan, NY

718441f.title: Manhattan: Central Park West - 62nd Street (West)
718441f.text:
Central Park West, west side, from West 62nd to 63rd Streets, showing the New Theatre, which later became the Century Opera House. This building, designed by Carrere and Hastings, was completed in 1908-9. This photo, or a similar one appeared in the December, 1909 issue of"Architecture." An account of the proposed plans will be found in the New York Sun-Sunday--July 24, 1906.
1909
Gift of Urbrock Collection
Copyright-1909
By George P. Hall & Son
718441f.folder: Central Park West & 62nd Street (West), Manhattan, NY

718442f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park West - 62nd Street (West)
718442f-a.text:
Central Park West, west side, between West 62nd and 63rd Streets. Prominent building shown with the Twin Towers, is the Century Apartments, (No. 25 Central Park West). On the right appears a portion of the Hotel Mayflower (S.W. corner of West 62nd Street), and on the left, the Society for Ethical Culture (N.W. corner of West 63rd Street), with the West 63rd Street Branch of the Y.M.C.A. at its rear. This view is taken from Central Park; the east side of this street.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
718442f-a.folder: Central Park West & 62nd Street (West), Manhattan, NY

718235f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park West - 62nd Street
718235f-a.text:
Central Park: The Lake and westerly building outline. The latter is formed by the apartment structures that line the thoroughfare, Central Park West. Dominant on same is the twin towered San Remo Apartments. This occupies the 74th-75th Street frontage. At the left is the outstanding Century Apartments at 62nd-63rd Street.
July 1930
July 1931
George L. Balgue
718235f-a.folder: Central Park West & 62nd Street, Manhattan, NY

718443f-a.title: Manhattan: Central Park West - 62nd Street
718443f-a.text:
View across clearing after demolition of Century Theatre, Central Park West, west side, from 62nd to 63rd Streets.
January 23, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
(2)
The same, taken from 62nd Street west of Central Park West.
January 31, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

718444f-b.title: Manhattan: Central Park West - 62nd Street
718444f-b.text:
(1)
Century Theatre (1909), Central Park West, west side, from 62nd
to 63rd Streets, from Central Park.
August 29, 1928.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)
Demolition of Century Theatre. The Century Apartments will
occupy this site.
January 8, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(3)
Stage and Boxes of the Century Theatre exposed in the process
of demolition.
January 8, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
